expression.Value: Welcome to the Fōrmulæ website
What is Fōrmulæ ?
Fōrmulæ is a programming language. It has the following characteristics:
It is expression oriented, everything in Fōrmulæ is an expression.

Unlike most of programming languages, expressions in Fōrmulæ are not defined as text, instead, they are defined structurally. It makes possible to show expressions in a human-like format. The following is an example of an expression:
It is

oriented and interpreted. It runs in an interactive environment where the user creates the input expression, executes them and then the resulting expression is returned to the user (it is also known as
read–eval–print loop
environment). The Fōrmulæ environment is what you are using right now, it is your web browser.
The input expressions can vary from simple calculations to complete, complex programs.
Not every expressions must be executed, there are expressions intended to show information to the user, just like the text you are reading right now.
The script can be saved to a regular file, in order to be retrieved later, or to be sent to another person.

Examples. If you press <ENTER> when any of the following input expression (in white background) is selected (or a part of it), it will be executed and the result will be shown in grey background. Try changing the numeric expressions (select them and press <SPACE>) to see what happens:
Execution of expressions

The environment (your web browser) is a front-end. The execution of expressions are performed by a server. There are two types of servers: remote servers and local servers, as they are described below:
Remote servers
Remote servers are a set of public, widely available servers, which can accept expressions from anyone.
A remote server has the following limitations:

It has a limit on the size of the input expression, and the time of its computation. It is due to a remote server has to execute many expressions at the same time, from many users other than you. Another reason is to avoid computations related to cryptocurrency mining proof-of-work.

There are expressions that remote servers are instructed not to execute. For example, even when you can construct an expressions to build and send e-mails, they are not executed by a remote server, because it could be used for e-mail spamming. Another example are expressions related to file management, because it could open the possibility that users could modify or delete files of the server
Using remote server is intended for casual users, or for activities that do not require intensive computation power, for example for teaching computer programming.
Local server

A local server is a private server, it only can accept expressions from the same computer where it is running. If you want to have your own server, you have to download, install and configure it. However, it has no limitation on size, computation time, or types of expressions it can execute. See
User's manual
of Fōrmulæ programs, grouped by categories.
of Fōrmulæ expressions, grouped by field (arithmetics, logic, etc.).
